text: I got for Monday and friday lunch deals, food is good but the service is very very slow. It can take put to 25 to 30 min to get lunch meal

What a fun and energized venue! Skeptical Chymist is tucked in a corner, but well worth the find! Seahawk flags greet you outside, as well as clever window displays. The inside is clean and friendly. 3 nearly wall sized TV screens flank the front hosting a variety of sporting events sure to please any sports fan! A large prominant bar lines the opposite wall. The drink and food menu is varied with a great selection of beers, wines and specialty drinks. We started with a sampler of their signature Guinness Infused IPA followed by the Soft Pretzel appetizers. The pretzels were warm, light and flaky served with smoked Gouda fondu and a beer and dijon mustard dip. They were Outstanding! We'll come back for this alone! The entre portions here are plenty! The Smoked Gouda Mac N Cheese will not disappoint! The Fish N Chips as well as the Chicken Strips were also tasty.
Our servers were friendly and attentive and we even met the owner, Derek! Skeptical Chymist has everything a 12 would want in a modern Irish bar! We can't wait to visit again and experience a Hawk game!
Thanks for a fun evening!  Kathy, from Washington State

Having our own little St. Patrick's Day soiree planned this year, my family decided to go out and do a little  Irish research.  We headed out to The Skeptical Chemist for dinner.  We have been here 5 or 6 times for dinner, drinking and all things Irish.... but this was definitely a school night dinner.  I dug out the Entertainment Card (a girl has to make cuts somewhere) and the four of us headed over.  We arrived and settled into an open table.  It was early; we were really just interested in some Celtic grub and a quick pint.  Fish and Chips, Shepherd Pie, Potato skins and some Harp Beer Battered Chicken Tenders rounded out our order to share.  All good dishes...as always.  Add a couple of beers and we were on our way to St. Patty's Day research nirvana.  All was good.   No complaints... until.... the check arrived.
Not only was it very confusing... Additions, subtractions and ?????(Remember we had our Entertainment Card, buy one dinner entree, get one free) the waitress had taken it upon herself to add an 18% gratuity without even mentioning it to us (a table of 4)  Hahahha     Bad decision on her part.   My husband ALWAYS OVERTIPS!  She screwed herself. He was pretty put out that she did that, and then did not even have the courtesy to mention it.   Anyway, if you are looking for a NoScott Irish bar,  Skep Chem could be your place for the 17th.
Food, beer, ambiance are good.... Just check your check for automated tipping!  Happy Saint Patrick's Day!  In case you can't tell, I'm IRISH!

Cool hidden spot in North Scottsdale right next to the 101 tucked in a small shopping plaza.  Love the dark feel on hot, sunny days.  Cold beer and great service.  Lots of tvs and perfect place to watch sports.  Also, the relatively new menu and happy hour items are a huge improvement.  Really enjoy the mussels and potato skins.  Definitely worth a stop if you are nearby.
Good food and great beer selection!!! Definitely stop by for a pint. The fish and chips are the best I have seen in a while.

great selection of beers on tap!  I am pleased to go into a place that offers a different selection from the normal sports bar, yet still has plenty of the old stand byes!  food is great, happy hour is awesome! I love the daily specials, which encourage me to try something new at a reasonable price as well!  service is rock star super awesome and amazing as well! i usually end up in Joey's section and also had the pleasure of  being served by Kyle this evening.. both are super helpful in helping me decide on a delicious beer and always there with a smile or anything i need!  this is one place id be proud to be a regular at!

I used to be a regular here, but something in the last 8 to 12 months sucked the soul out of SC.  A good selection of late night pub food, friendly service and great atmosphere.   Last couple of times I went, the food needed some serious improvement and getting a beer at the bar I felt like I was throwing a wrench in the bartender's coital plans for the evening.

Bring back the huge chicken fingers (and season them!), excellent sauces and remind the bartenders that for every bloke that has to wait 10 minutes for a pint because he's making the moves on a patron, Four Peaks is just a stone's throw away.

Walked in and the SeaHawkers club had just left.  The place was a wreck and they were scrambling to get the tables cleaned and the restaurant back in order.

Good service, good food and cold drinks.  Use the 4Square app and unlock an additional dollar off your drinks, even during happy hour.
I just had the BEST fish & chips at this restaurant! Delicious food,  service is EXCELLENT! Love it!

This was possibly the worst restaurant experience I've had in my three years in north Scottsdale. For starters, the food was extra salty. I had a cheeseburger with bacon and had to take off the bacon to make it edible. My friend had a smoked salmon sandwich extremely salty- the sandwich and bread. Then to top it off we were watching he Pacquiao and Horn fight, they cut it off right before the winner was announced. The ultimate ruin to a great fight. Unfortunately it was covered by horrible waitress service. We literally had to give our order while she ran by the table. Will not be going back to that spot and advise others to proceed with caution.

Great Irish bar! 

Great authentic food (I attribute any poor review to the fact that authentic Irish food doesn't taste like American dishes...who knew?), but they have typical bar food as well. Excellent place to watch sports (it is a WA bar, so Seahawks and Huskies will be featured) with an excellent selection of beers, Irish whiskey, and Scotch.

We waited 45 minutes for our food. Not god because we were in a rush! 
Once the food finally got to us I was impressed by the food presentation. It wasnt just thrown on the late. My peppercorn encrusted pork loin was sliced and fanned and placed a top special red onions laddened with green beans and scallopped potatoes.
we went here because we saw a coupon in val pak.  THEY ADD TIP WITH THIS COUPON. the coupon says skillfuly preparred so i guess thats the warning it takes awhile to cook the food. the food didnt appear to be microwaved or seated under a heat lamp . the food was just freshly hot!
 my boyfriends fish and chips were just fish and chips. small piece of fish with shoe string FF . we ordered Ice tea to drink and you get a huge glass. so kudos there
plenty of seating in here. dark but nice looking for an irish pub tables and chairs hard hard wood uncmfortable. and if your a tall person sit at a high top.

 But I wont be back. Service took to long. Male waiter was moody and grouchy. and i didnt feel comfortable.

This place reminded us of our trip to Ireland recently! The atmosphere (minus the big screen TVs) was very much like Irish restaurants/pubs. The food was very good as well, and the service was very quick. We'd definitely return!

was in the area from out of town, stopped by and had delicious fish & chips and a stongbow cider..

service was good, food & drinks were good.. really enjoyed it..!!
Open late, have a nice, rotating beer selection. The staff is friendly. Good place!

Everyone, please be advised - Happy Hour ends promptly at 6:00 PM. If you show up at 6:04 sit at the bar, and ask if it's still happy hour, the nasty bartender bitch will respond with a sarcastic "no" and then walk away like she's too good to serve you. Not only that, but when you inquire about the different beers they offer and how they categorize them on their elementary chalkboard, she will laugh at you like you're some kind of amateur who's never been outside of the four walls of your house. Menu is generic, nothing that differentiates it as a true Irish Pub. I was disgusted by the bartender's snotty attitude and we left without spending a dime. I'll never go back.

I L-O-V-E the Skeptical Chymist!  I went for a Seahawks game, while visiting Phoenix and had an amazing time.  The decor is great and the atmosphere was lots of fun. The staff was very friendly and effiient.  I had fish and chips, which was very good and my friend had the cod sliders, which she loved.  This place is everything an Irish Pub should be.

In my search for trivia nights ,  I visited the place this Tuesday. Place wasnt too crowded, not sure its the norm. The food was decent  and service was ok. The place can be difficult to find in the complex . The trivia was fun, good variety of questions and overall ok experience. I will visit again on a trivia night but will keep it as one of the options, not the only one.

We took our kids here for St Paddy's Day dinner. I don't recommend doing this. My husband and I were charged a $10 cover at 4 in the afternoon and even after explaining we would just be there for dinner and we were told we had to leave by 6pm when their restaurant turns into a 21 and over venue only. Their menu was limited for the holiday so I wasn't allowed to order the hummus plate I wanted so I got garlic fries which were yummy. My kids and husband ordered the corned beef and cabbage and were disappointed in the small portion, but satisfied with the taste. They had a brown gravy over the corned beef which I thought was unusual. We ordered one of the bread puddings to share and should have ordered two. I'll be back for the bread pudding and a beer...without my kids and not on St. Paddy's Day.

This establishment has become our neighborhood favorite simply because of one reason:  the exceptional food. Everything that we've ordered, from the yummy shepherd's pie (with LAMB) to the spiced-how-you-would-like-it chicken curry to the savory mussels in broth have been consistently strong. Flavors are complex and well-developed.

Our only complaint is the service; it is very inconsistent. We don't expect or desire it to be overly attentive, but the majority of time we go there, we feel pretty ignored. Maybe it's just us, but I suspect not! Luckily, the food will keep us coming back for more.

I absolutely love this place!
My boyfriend and I come here for happy hour drinks about once a week and love to arrange meet-ups with our friends here.

The atmosphere is awesome! Every inch of the place is designed to look like an old Irish pharmacy. There is always something cool to look at.

The staff is always friendly and helpful. I've only once had a problem with a bad attitude from one of their servers and haven't seen that girl since. Everyone else is an absolute pleasure and always willing to answer questions and make suggestions. Very attentive and charismatic.

It can get pretty crowded (don't even bother coming on a night the SeaHawks are playing) but there is plenty of seating and a small party can usually find a table. Larger groups should plan on arriving early and coming on less busy weeknights.

They have a great selection of beer, wine and cider and a full bar for any mixed drink you want. They also cycle seasonal and promotional beers regularly so there is always something new to try and they're always happy to let you have a complimentary taste, which I love! Prices seem pretty standard to me. Happy hour has great deals and every day of the week has its own all-day drink special.

The food is really hit or miss. The burgers are amazing and the chicken tenders are great but a lot of their food in general is a bit atypical. For instance, the flatbread pizzas come in varieties including "bacon onion jalepeno" or "date and black pepper" but just a meat'n'cheese choice isn't on the menu and their "tacos" consist of pulled pork and coleslaw. Everything I've tried has been totally delicious, but if you're looking for good ol' simple bar food, you might not like their menu unless you're willing to be adventurous. Like with the drinks, there is a daily special every day of the week except Sundays and flatbreads as well as appetizers are half-off during happy hour.

One of my personal favorite reasons for coming to this bar is Tuesday Night Pub Quiz. Live bar trivia in teams that's WAY more fun than the answer pads and monitors used at other bars. There are a number of regular teams but we've had lots of fun getting a ragtag group together to go and try our best.

Overall, I fully intend to continue frequenting this place for it's charm and feel-good atmosphere.

A friend suggested we meet here, as it was kind of in between him and us (that is to say, 1/2 hour for us, 2 hours for him). He hadn't been before, but thought it sounded good. It is as good an Irish Pub as I would expect to find in a strip mall. Since all were driving, we didn't partake in the Irish spirits, but I have no doubt they do this well, as evidenced by the other patrons. I had the shrimp louie, which was very good. My companions seemed to enjoy their dishes (burger and fish and chips) as well. The fish and chips were huge. It wasn't very noisy, but that may have been largely due to the unusually small crowd. The service was extremely attentive. Overall, I was quite impressed and will keep this in mind for the next time we're in the area.
Great food, great selection of craft beer and great service.  Love Chris and Bridget! Slainte!
The Skeptical Chymist is the place to be! Great environment and the staff is amazing, especially the server DV! He's super awesome with a beard of a legend. This place is legit! GO HAWKS!!

What happened? Have been visiting for years....always enjoyed. In the past month have visited twice and ordered a half and half as usual.....pretty simple for an Irish Pub....both times they asked what do you mean...there are lots of half and halfs. Well it is Guinneas and Harp...duh. They never asked before......
Both times it came totally mixed. Employees said owner did something to the nitrogen mix ...probably to save money. Apparently they pour correctly with spoon and then the separation disappears and you get a mucky mix. HORRIBLE. 
Also, other guests with me ordered their usual beers and they were not very cold the last couple of visits. Icky cool beers. More money saving?
I'd rather they raise themprice for a good product then charge the same for dreck.
What a disappointment. Guess we will all be lookin' for a new pub. Hate to....always enjoyed my visits...must be 100 or so.....

I was in town to attend Super Bowl 49 and was directed towards this establishment because it is a Seahawks bar.  It was fun to connect with fellow 12s from all around the country. The bar itself was overrun with the large crowds in town for Super Bowl.  The staff seemed overwhelmed and could not wait for the weekend to be over.  The food was okay but nothing to brag about. The live band they hired to perform on Friday night was terrible. The overall vibe was fun and I will stop by next year when the Seahawks are in town to play the Cardinals.

Went here twice. I agree with one of the other yelpers, that the service was inconsistent.

1st visit was on a Friday night. The place was packed, but the server was friendly and attentive. The decor was really nice. It was a little loud, but the place was good enough for a 2nd visit.

2nd visit was on a Saturday afternoon. The place was dead, maybe two tables occupied in the patio, yet we waited 20 minutes without any service. The server came in and out several times to help the other tables, but not once did she show us any acknowledgement, menus, water, nothing. I think the only time the server recognized our presence was when we were walking out. I hope she saw my dissatisfaction.
The service was so slow. She didn't even come check on us despite waiting 30 min for our apps!
Who else wants their money back? Commercial Superbowl parties should not be hosted by amateurs.

Love this place!  The layout is interesting and set up in a way that would allow very large groups to sit together without sharing an awkward table, or it forces other parties to interact and, you know... actually be social at a bar...!
It was a pretty slow evening when we arrived, so we snagged a couple of seats at the bar and had a great experience.  The bartender was very friendly and walked us through their extensive beer list.  My husband tried a few flights and liked every recommendation.    We ordered mussels and beef wellington - both were to die for!  
I imagine this is the place to be for St. Patrick's Day or during football season, the patio seemed pretty nice too.  We'll definitely be back!

Our first time dining here and we will return again.  Our waitress, Danielle, greeted us cheerfully, brought drinks, took our order and followed up with just the right amount of attentiveness.  We ordered the flat bread 1/2 off Wednesday specials.  I had the BBQ topping minus the onions.  The sauce might have been a bit more tasty but the flat bread was really good.  The lunch time crowd was modest but everyone seemed to be served with a smile and the food came out in a reasonable time period.

The decor is quite interesting and is a nice change from the often sterile atmosphere of many a grill.  Give the place a try.

This place is pretty cool. I like that its a Seahawks pub! I tried the fish and chips and it was pretty tasty! Can't wait to try other stuff on the menu! Definitely coming back, gonna have to try and watch the game!

I went here with a group of co-workers Monday evening after work. I was suprised to see how tucked back and hidden SC is in the strip mall area it's situated in (if in a different location this place could have great potential). Once inside, it was completely empty (which I couldn't believe, especially for a big Monday night football game, plus it seemed like a cool Irish pub). They had awesome happy hour specials ($5 burgers w/ fries), which made me want to come back again and try new things out. I went ahead with the lamb shepard's pie which was great, and everyone else enjoyed their meals as well. 
Overall a great experience...I'll be back for more!

This is a Seahawks themed bar , I'm from Seattle so I appreciate a little home town loving!    Had the basic burger .... About what you would expect from a bar.    Amazing!!  Lol!   
Can't wait to come back here and try to watch a game here.   Hopefully hawks vs cardinals!

We went around 12 noon frist clue,the place was just about empty. Music was loud and obnoxious for lunch time during the week. Which is sad the nice thing about Irish Pubs is the varied music. I decided to order a draft No Murphy's No Bemish, only Irish brewers were Guinness or Harp.Which the bartender lacked the skill of layering. When I sent my drink back and ordered an IPA the bartender left the bar to serve me up. Threw the coaster violently at the table when placing my drink down infront of me told me I did not know how to order my half and half they never stay seprated. UNPROFESSIONAL,rude and stupid.I should of left than but was with my 80 year old father who doesn't get around well.
I ordered Turkey Club with sweet potato fries. Not too much of a sandwich for 12$ My dad got a burger it was just ok

This place was great - we were in town trying to find a place to watch the Mexico-Panama World Cup qualifier and stopped by this place after Four Peaks, which was overcrowded and playing baseball only. Even though they didn't have the game, we stayed anyway. They have open seating and it was lively, but not crowded, on Friday night ($5 Irish car bombs!). As soon as we sat down, our waiter came by and immediately took our drink orders while we looked over their menu. Very attentive the entire night. He made some great recommendations. I had a pear cider (which was life-changingly good) and the boyfriend stuck to Guiness. For dinner, we shared the pork tacos (were some of the best tacos my boyfriend's ever had, and he grew up in Mexico) and the bacon jalepeno flatbread (which were good, but not spectacular). For dessert, we ordered the bread pudding and it was perfectly rich without being overwhelming. The live music they had was this older gent playing mainly 90s hits on an acoustic guitar, and was a perfect addition to the atmosphere. It is a little pricier than we were expecting, but for Scottsdale and the quality, you can't get much better than this place. We will definitely be back next time we're in town!

Our party of four had dinner here, three of us ordered burgers, one got the steak special. Three out of four really liked the food, so I guess that's 75 percent customer satisfaction. The place was packed (there was a group watching a college football game--extremely loud) and the service was slow and forgetful, we had to ask more than once for things. I'd go back, although I doubt that one of our companions would ever do so--his burger was way overcooked, he had to ask for ketchup repeatedly and finally just got up and swiped it from another table. But the oddest thing was when he asked for mayo, the server looked at him like he was crazy and like she'd never heard of such a thing. The men were happy with their beers (one ordered a Black & Tan) and the women w/their drinks. We got dessert to go, it was very good (bread pudding and a brownie) the next day.

We went to Skeptical last night(Sat 10/5). We frequent this bar because we like the food and the music.  We could not believe how bad we were treated.  Even tho the website said Aussie Jim was playing football was on. When we asked the bartender we were told-curtly-that there would be no music. We sat at the bar and ordered a drink and the bartender was very unfriendly.  She never, ever, smiled once.  We ordered food and another drink and we were asked " Are you ready to settle your bill?"  Really?  We left, went to Four Peaks and proceeded to spend 100.00 on food and drinks.   The Skeptical bartender chased away profits. I own a business and know what it takes to protect my profits. IF I go to this bar again I will not sit at the bar again and be disrespected by someone who is taking my money.  The bartenders and staff at Four Peaks were fantastic so I have to think that is where I want to spend my time and money.  I cannot say the name of the bartender because she did not have a name tag but the bleach blond hair should be a clue....

I have been coming to the Chymist since it opened.  It was a great local bar with personable and attentive  bartenders, waitstaff and even the owners are cool.

This past summer it's lost it's mojo.  The bartenders have become curt and unfriendly (especially the blonde gal)

Trevor, please spend more time at your Bar.  It suffers without you!
Always a great place to enjoy some Irish fair, a few Guinness drafts and some great live music. Staff is always attentive, Had a great St Paddy's day! Cant wait till next year

Sweetest staff and great beer selections. By far my new favorite place to grab a beer!! Still haven't tried any food yet but I don't normally eat out much. Great place for good conversation and a fun, more laid back night. I'm definitely a new regular now!

I was told about this place as the unofficial home for the Seahawks (aka as the SeaChickens) in this area.  Seattle was playing a Thursday night game, so a group of fans and I decided to go there and give it a go. It is a Irish style pub tucked into a corner in a strip mall.  Although I had been in the mall a number of times visiting Golfsmiths, Best Buy, and Northern Lights, I had no inkling this place was even there. We got there early, jut in time for Happy Hour, and it was great. Half price off of all appetizers and flatbreads, and $2.00 off all beers and wine. In addition, they have great daily specials.

It has quite a gathering for Seahawk games, and it can be pretty noisy and wild during the games.  However, I did return on a Monday night to try their $5.00 hamburger (a great bargain), and although it was busy, it was a very friendly and easy going atmosphere.

With their daily specials, great happy hour, and friendly atmosphere, this could become one of my favorite places.

Had a great tine tonight with this red headed server.  Polite, great to talk with and the bald beared server was awesome too.  We were here on draft night, love the surroundings.  Stop by for a cold beer and great food.

My wife and I ate here Sat., July 9th. I ordered the special, corned beef and cabbage. The cabbage was somewhat undercooked, almost raw.
My wife ordered a rum and coke. When we got the bill, we were charged for premium rum which we did not order. An 18% tip was added to the bill. The waitress was worth about 10% based on service.
We won't be back, but will inform others to be aware of what we found.
The place is dirty, with dust on furniture and decor.

I go here quite a bit, especially on Sunday for the $3 drafts.  The cook here is very good but the talent only shows on some dishes.  The fries need a little work.  They are delicious but, and I don't know how this happens,  they are too fragmented.  Why do we get so many tiny pieces of French fries in the basket?  The date flatbread was an interesting idea, but I don't think it works.  In general,  I wish the flatbreads were not such a dominant part of the small plate menu.  The Reuben is the best I have had except for maybe Chompies.
The food is good for its price, but as a Seahawks bar, it's allowed to get very raccous for Sunday games.

Stopped in for lunch a few weeks ago, the verdict: overpriced mediocre and slow. The Reuben was unremarkable and I nearly died of thirst. Latenight is better with plenty of half and half stouts (ie black and blue) and generally likeable live music on weekends.
Best beer selection in the area. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the different beers.

Great Happy Hour! I have been to the all day happy hour on Sundays and they have great deals including all the craft beers too! Only downfall is its a seahawk support  bar so if you are a fan of any other team it is hard to sit to watch any other game but great service! great food! and a great beer selection!

Awesome place to come and watch the game. The food is REALLY good too. Went here with my some family and Jillian was our server and she was great! People like that can really light up a place. I have yet to take my boyfriend here and his office is so close, I can't wait to show him this great find! :)

We really enjoy this pub, especially on Tuesdays for quiz night. The food is what you would expect and the service is excellent. Being close to our home is also a plus. The interior is well thought out and a real departure once one steps through the door from the strip mall atmosphere where the pub is located. I can't believe that someone complained about the parking unless they are unable to walk 50 yards out into the GIGANTIC parking lot that serves this pub and all the other business within close proximity. The crowd is a real mixed bag which is great. One can tell this pub is owned by actual British folk (Scottish actually - even better).
i always forget how amazing the craft beer selection is here until i walk in again.  god i love this bar!

Warning! Do not go here on Sundays unless you are a Seahawks fan! My boyfriend and I were looking for a new place to watch football, and innocently walked into this place wearing our football jerseys of a different team...big mistake! We actually got booed! This place is a Seahawk only zone, and nobody else is welcomed. If you are looking for a fun place to watch football in the area, head over to Twin Peaks which is within walking distance. They have great food and a fantastic football atmosphere where everyone is welcome.

Though they had a decent selection of beer, I was disappointed that they told us the kitchen was closed at 10:10pm when we called before heading there at 10pm to ask the closing time and was told 11pm. Good thing buffalo wild wings was willing to serve.
Didnt get a chance to actually eat here, we showed up as the kitchen went on to their late night menu. But the hostess was very kind and the service seemed on point just wrong timing on our part.

This place is a fantastic Irish pub. The staff is friendly, the food and drinks are great. I have always had good experiences here. If you like soccer or any sports they are always on.  Unless they have live music

If you don't have a good time at the Chymist, you don't know how to have a good time. Do you self a favour and just stay home. 

Thanks for doing such a fine job.

First confession- I've only ever enjoyed alcoholic beverages here. First voyage brought me here to enjoy a pint of Guinness. They have a variety of different beers which has kept me coming back. I have yet to try any food-they have some delicious varieties but maybe a bit too heavy for my tastes, some lighter options besides salads would warrant some good competition from their Four Peaks neighbor. The staff is always courteous and attentive.

If you are headed here for St. Patrick's weekend, I would be indeed skeptical. The corned beef and cabbage plate was laughable - 4 puny slices of corned beef, a scoop of potatoes and a nominal portion of shredded cabbage. What kitchen guy talked management into that?
Go for a Harp or some whiskey, but save your appetite for a place that serves real portions or you will still have an appetite after dining here. 
P.S The demi-glaze on the corned beef was plain silly.

Nice place to go with friends and enjoy a wide array of beers. I have only tried the nachos as far as food goes but it was pretty good. My only complaint is that every time I've been there the place is dead quiet.

I really really really want to give it five stars. And it's really bothering me that I didn't, but I feel something is missing here. I mean the food is good, try the Rasher burger and fish and chips, the drinks are cool, 3 dollar Carlsbergs, but something is seriously missing.....? 

The atmosphere is nice and "pubby" and even my server the last couple times had an Irish accent, but why don't I feel right when I leave? 

The prices don't knockout the wallet, and the speed of service is relatively impressive...

Ok, it's defintely worth stopping in and grabbing a burger or fish and chips, and a couple guiness', and if you feel the same way I do, let me know why, because I sure don't?????? Maybe it's the.......

I love this place me and my mom go every other week for football and it is always packed with Seahawks fans and the severs are great they remember our orders and every thing I tell any seahawks fan about this place.

Go Hawks!!!

I'm not from Scottsdale but was visiting and wanted to go to a bar with friends where we could hang out for a bit.  We looked up bars on yelp [naturally] and came across Skeptical Chymist.  We had a blast!  The bar staff was really friendly and the drinks were inexpensive.  Technically, I guess this is an "irish pub" but I would categorize it as better than a typical one - I mean, they played wilco and the shins, people.  The drinks were poured extremely well (my gin and tonics were perfectly mixed) and there seemed to be regulars enjoying the evening.

A must stop for any Seahawk fan! I was here for the Super Bowl and the Saturday night prior. The place was beyond packed and the atmosphere was just electric. Sadly the game didn't go our way, but it was still a great experience. Next time I'm in AZ I need to check this place out on a less crazy weekend. Go Hawks!

Tried the fish n chips since it's been a long time and I was in the mood for fish n chips!
Portion was good, I cleaned my plate.
Chips (fries) could've been crispier, they were kinda soft, but still delicious and it didn't stop me from shoveling them in! Fish was OK. Not a flat fillet, but a chunk. 
Beer list looked VERY SOLID and filled with quality crafts including Firestone's Sticky Monkey. I didn't have a beer cuz I was on lunch, but I mentally chose a flight for myself.
I asked about the mussels dish, and was told it was very good - my server's favorite. I like mussels a lot so I might try that when I return. You'll notice "(PEI)" next to the title of the dish -- the mussels are from Prince Edward Island!
INSIDE SKINNY: All you can eat fish n chips on Fridays for $14 and half-off apps during happy hour! Check out the website for other daily specials.

Mediocre, overpriced food, delivered slow and cold. Some of the worst service I've ever had to pay for. And stay away from any special events. You'll end up dealing with a short, bald, hothead owner that clearly doesn't have the fortitude to handle a large venue. Save your money, and go to the place 100 yards to the North, which has a better facility, and friendlier/more attractive staff.
Great place to eat with a laid back atmosphere. The food is fantastic and prepared perfectly. They also have a great selection of beer. But definitely recommend.

I really wanted to like The Skeptical Chymist - it's described as an Irish pub with the look of an old apothecary shop.  What I walked into was a mishmash of kitchy pub and Seattle Seahawks sports bar.  There were only two other tables occupied so we thought we'd get quick service, but I suppose they don't advertise quick service so it was ridiculous to expect it.  What we did get was: 1 child size portion of corned beef & cabbage at full portion price, one plate with food that was specifically requested not to be there, and my plate had a special surprise of something I'm highly allergic to buried under my sweet potato fries - at no extra charge to me, of course.  The food was not good, but not the worst thing I'd ever had - until it came to the bread and butter pudding.  It was elastic, plastic and unnaturally chewy.  The only way to get bread pudding to change from bread and custard to elastic and dish sponge is by brutally torturing it in a microwave.  Please don't take people you like to eat here.
we are huge fans of this totally awesome place i like to call home... but even bigger fans of our waitress

This is a solid pub. The atmosphere was nice and service was good. The best part is their great happy hour and specials. Happy hour is 4-7pm daily. Half off appetizers and $2 off beer and wine. the mussels were pretty big and very tasty. We also ordered the jalapeno onion flatbread which was a little soggy but had good flavor. I would go back here again for sure!
A great little gem in the middle of silicone and generic places. Great music, vibes and of course, beer. I highly recommend the KÃ¶nig Ludwig Weissbier on tap. It is organic and tasty!!

Decent pub with a decent vibe, as long as you can find it buried in the corner of a strip mall. Any craic during the week must end by 10 and they look to close up as soon after that as possible. This sounds like a bad review, but really the place is pretty nice. They can't help that they set up shop in scottsdull. They had a pub quiz on Tuesday and a singer/guitarist on Wednesday, so they are, at least, creative. 

On the plus side, they have an excellent black bean burger for the veggies. And to repeat: a decent pub with a decent vibe. I have not spent too much time in this area but that could be larger commodity than I know. Competing with Twin Peaks and Short Kilts, well, it's an easy win there.

I have really tried to like this place. Love the vibe and concept. Two things kill it for me: 

1 - Cigar smokers on the patio that set-up next to service window and make the entire restaurant permeate and reek of smoke. There has to be a middle ground. FYI, 90% of Arizonans DO NOT SMOKE. Most good restaurants ban smoking all together (Four Peaks or OHSO).  At a minimum only allow smoking away from the window. 

2 - Server 101, "Everything'" on the menu is NOT great. Pick out a couple of items from each category that you are passionate about and can speak to. When a server says everything is great, it tells me they either do not know the menu or are poorly trained. 

If you like a smokey bar that is Irish themed, then go for it. If you are in the neighborhood, I would suggest the other two places mentioned.
You wouldn't expect that  a place with such a name is an Irish restaurant. It's just fine. But it isn't anything that would make you're great great grandmother weep for her motherland.

Big fan of the Belfast burger, especially on Mondays when it's a mere $5. Great beer list and good service.

Never been here for live music or Seahawks games, but it's a nice atmosphere anyway.

I went here for the lunch special and some beer. Both were good, but the bar service was lacking. Nicole C ?    was constantly leaving the bar area to run drinks out to the entire place!. It got worse when she disappeared for long stretches of time. There was nobody tending the bar for quite a few long periods of time. She was nowhere to be seen. I found that quite unusual and annoying.

Stumbled on to this bar by accident. Wasn't too busy on a tuesday night but oh man was I glad i did. Great irish pub. Tasty food and good beer. Odd note, there was something they put on their roasted veggies that was amazing. Maybe it was just Parmesan butter or maybe it was something else. Either way, i like it. If im in the area, this is the bar i want to go to.

This would probably be my favorite place if it wasn't  for the smoky smell inside.  They might as well allow smoking inside as it smells as if they already do.  I always thought that you had to be so many feet away from the inside of the establishment when you smoked.  People basically smoke at the bar.
Visiting from Seattle and what an awesome find!! Seahawks bar out here in AZ gotta love that!! Great beer, great food, awesome atmosphere and lots of Seahawks fans!

I can't say enough about this place. Please look at my Yelp about Arribas on Pima and you'll understand how much I  skeptical more than I did in the first place. They came to our rescue after Arribas REFUSED to wait on a table of 15 very hungry and thirsty women after a long day of work, on Cinco de Mayo. It was a well organized reunion of girlfriends; reservation was in 2 weeks prior. Nightmare. I'm a Seahawker, called skeptical to see if they could accommodate us, all 15 of us walked over a and found tables set, menus standing up and a waitress ready to take our orders. From the delicious oatmeal shots to the pear cider to the amazing wings, it was the BEST Cinco de Mayo we could have ever asked for! Proud to be a SEAHAWK!!!! Now skeptical has 14 more fans that I can take with me on game days!
Had a great time here on St. Patrick's Day! The event outside in the tent with the drink selections were great. Live music was entertaining and the crowd was also very fun!
Good for drinks but I have yet eaten anything there that was actually good. They do pour a good Guinness!

Was able to get a table for the Seahhawks Vs Saints game. WE got a table on the patio. Even as busy as they were, the service was prompt and spot on! I only give it 3 stars because I didn't try the food, and there was only 1 very small TV on the patio.

I love everything about this place. It's one of the best "Irish bars" in Scottsdale and the atmosphere is very cool. Sort of 19th century apothecary sort of place with a wonderful staff and great selection of beer and spirits. Of course, the drinks are great and they sure know how to pour Guinness and all it's wonderful concoctions (Black & Tan, etc.). What may surprise you is the food. Do the whole "when in Rome" thing and get some Irish fare. Their Shepherd's Pie is fantastic.

trying to see the menu as it has been a long time since I was there.  No Menu on the website?  How can that be?  
Update please.

Staff quickly took care of the "down" menu!.  Looks good.  I will go by and try you again.  Thanks for the quick action
Friendly staff. Lots of beer. It's hot in here, I'm sweating. Beers could be colder too. I haven't had the food.

The Middleton is always expensive but dam its good.  This is a great place to go for good music, great fish sandwiches and amazing bread pudding.  (make sure you ask them for a piece from the middle of the pan and extra sauce as these are the best pieces- very moist and delicious)  They often have live entertainment.  The patrons are very nice most of them professionals of some sort and the bartenders are great.  I like the atmosphere but whoever picked this location should have their head examined.  Its hard to find and the parking which is a small inconvenience for me is most likely a big deal for others who don't like to walk or stagger long distances.  Still highly recommended for a great Irish experience.

I visited The Skeptical Chymist for the first time on Halloween night. The evening featured live music and even a costume contest with great prizes.

The Skeptical Chymist is basically walking distance from where I live, so I was excited to give it a try. I also can't help but be drawn to the name (it's a cool name).

Overall, I was pretty impressed with The Skeptical Chymist. It's everything you would expect of an Irish pub-themed bar experience.

TONS of indoor seated, plenty of outdoor seating, and truly unique styling add up to a fun experience and engaging ambiance.

I didn't order food, but the drink menu was surprisingly impressive, including a long list of craft beers handwritten to a chalkboard wall and even a decent number of quality scotches and bourbons (my favorite go-tos).

***During my visit, I was helped by a truly outstanding server named Derek. Derek had dressed up as Venom, which was really cool, too. He was talkative and engaging and fun. I couldn't have been more pleased with the service he provided. I'd go back on that alone.

Typically, Irish pub-themed bars are not my favorite. This one, however, is a notable exception. I'm biased because it's so close by, naturally, but I'd recommend it to anyone. If you haven't been, check it out. You won't be disappointed.

***THANK YOU, Derek, for providing such great service and for making me feel at home in a new place. I appreciated that very much.

This Is The Best Bar.  I've Been Coming Here For Two Years Now.  Service Is Excellent n The Food Is Amazing.  Derrick Is By Far My Favorite Server.  The Fact That This Bar Is My Favorite Football Team Spot Makes It Even Better.  My Friends That Aren't Seahawks Fan Even Love It.  If You Want A Great Night Out With Friends Come Here To Skeptical Chemist You Won't Leave Unsatisfied.  I Promise.

Seahawks central!

 It was a fun place to watch the Seahawks playoff game, though there were almost no specials for an NFL sunday game place--disappointing, considering that so many other bars offer at least a set of discounted apps and drinks for Sunday specials. The only offered $3.25 draft/bottles. 

The food was expensive, and while they were generous on the portions, paying $10/plate for anything isn't what you want while watching football. Nor was it anything special. 

The waitress was attentive and helpful. We had the fish and chips and a few beers, and it was a decent amount of food (a lot of fries). We wouldn't go back unless to specifically watch a Seahawks game during playoffs.
Not instant, but prompt service, and the waitress was perky and friendly. Decent food--Shepherd's Pie was good. If I lived nearby I'd go back. Liked the decor.

TOASTED BUNZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ !!!!!!!!!!!!!! FINALLY!   YESSSS!  INSERT STADIUM CHEERING!!!!   Score   SC

Ordered  Fish sliders, excellent, sturdy, delicious, all because of the toasted bunzzzzzzzzzz, this small important detail seems to almost always go overlooked at so many places,,,not here,,,,its the very foundation of almost anything Damn Good not becoming soggy, messy fast food crappy.

Husband loves their beers &  food too, hearty, kind of close to homemade.

Cool atmosphere, kind of dusty ship-wrecked, pirates and tales from the tomb. you know YE OLE  local pub. DIG IT.
Bartenders were rude! Didnt even acknowledge my boyfriend and until we were leaving. I wouldn't even selected one star but i cant move forward on posting this review

This Irish Pub is pretty hidden away, and I'm not sure I'd recommend searching it out.

They have a small, decent patio that's dog friendly, but unfortunately, to get there, you have to walk that dog around to the back of the building, passing through their disgusting trash area.  The view of the patio?  The noisy on-ramp to the 101 freeway.  It's also pretty dirty ... my wife ended up with bugs in her beer and her water.

So the patio isn't great, but service is good, the Happy Hour specials (1/2 off appetizers, $2 off drafts) are excellent, the beer is tasty, and the food is all fine.

It's a Seahawks Bar, so I bet during football season it's tons of fun.  I bet also St. Patrick's Day is a blast.  Outside of those times, I would only recommend coming here if you want a quick drink and appetizer during Happy Hour.

This place is a gem!  This was my 3rd time here, first time for lunch.  The food and service was spectacular!!! The fish and chips, the best I've ever had, including some places in London!! The Blackened Chicken Sandwich on TOASTED chibatta, done perfectly.  They also have amazing happy hour specials from 4-7 and I recommend the crab cakes.  This place is all around perfect, I just wish I would have found it sooner.  They also do a recurring Tuesday night trivia night, which packs the place and is great entertainment. 

Top notch all around!

Erica with a "C" was one of the most professional and personal bartenders that I've ever met. And that's saying a lot coming from someone in the restaurant industry! I was lucky enough to have my beer poured by her, which was amazingly poured by the way, with the perfect amount of head. She was attentive throughout my whole visit, and offered me another beer before my glass was empty,"which is brownie points in my book." Erica with a "C" is the best addition to your great bar since my first visit (4 years ago). If you amazing ladies like Erica with a "C", your bar will flourish more than it has since she started working!! 17.39/10 would recommend to my friends and colleagues.... Keep doing what you're doing!

My pal Comer said it best when he said "Bar food is a fickle master.  Certainly, there is something to be said for simple American fare made from high quality ingredients and served hot and fresh by a friendly beer wench with a smile and a wiggle.
 
That said, so often today, the standard menu of cheeseburgers, chicken sandwiches and cheese steaks is abused.  The cheese steaks are poor and the burgers bland.  With that in mind, one is prone to venture out to one of the higher classes of pub/grill establishements.  Skeptical Chemyst in North Scottsdale is one of these offering a bit of Irish flavor to tempt the odd fellow in search of beef and beer.
 
I have yet to see the aged Irish ex-pat responsible for this fine eatery.  In fact, I have come to grow suspicious of the somewhat Disney appearance of the decor.  Perhaps they tried just a bit too hard.  The menu is a lively mix of Irish sounding dishes and the typical American staples.  The servers are by and large female and attractive and for the most part friendly, but I digress.
 
The ruben, as should be expected is traditional and served with a large portion of thick cut fresh corned beef.  Possibly a little dry, I would ask for Mayo or extra dressing.  The fish and chips are served American style with smaller portions of breaded something or other or more traditionally, as large slab of half a fish in a nice beer batter breading.  The stew sounds promising but we were warned away from it by the staff.  go figure?
 
The highlight of the menu is the Belfast Burger.  A large patty of quality ground beef cooked to order. Yes, you can get it pink and warm in the middle.  Topping this burger is the magic.  Grilled onions peppers and shrooms dripping with cheese.  A large tasty bun, and a giant onion ring.  It is truly a mouth watering delight and when served with an icey Carlburg Lager is sure to leave any Irishman worth his clover feeling sated and happy.  A second Carlburg and a Car Bomb later and you will be ready to dance a jig with the lovely little brunette behind the bar aptly named Kelly.
 
The late night crowd is a disappointingly young group of college aged rugby wannabe's and their not so cute dates but lunch time is a pleasure and Happy Hour on the patio is a treat.  Most of the TV's are wasted showing soccer matches off the satelite dish but I suppose it adds to the flavor of this very cute, satisfying, mental vacation to Irie"

I can't understand how this place got only 3.5 stars,it is awesome food!!
The chicken tortilla soup was great,the meals are really big,and it's delicious 
Definitely 5 stars
Sorry the flat bread is a date, not fig flat bread!   it is AWESOME!  Sorry about the typo in my previous review!
The service was great, very friendly. The fish n chips were not greasy and they were big cuts of fish. FYI this is Seattle Seahawks bar. (Still didn't hinder my review, lol).

This place is really great. I love the decor, feels like you're in another place but really, you're in Scottsdale next to the freeway. They have live bands on the weekends, which is neat. They have a restaurant, bar, and outside smoking patio.

For St. Patty's Day, they have a big festival in the park with beer stands, games, and live bands. It gets really packed in the pub for St.  Patty's so if you're not into that, be warned! 

The food is great. I've had corned beef and cabbage and Shepherd's pie. Both were delicious and met my craving for "Irish" food.

I took my family to Skeptical Chymist to meet with some friends from work.  We definitely enjoyed the food a lot - it tastes fresh and made-from-scratch.  They definitely carry a lot of Irish beers and ales, which my friends tried and enjoyed.  I had a hamburger - which tasted great.  My family all had the Southwest Chicken Burger - and they all loved it - they said the chicken tasted like it was cooked on a grill.  I would suggest the owners add some acoustic panels in the ceiling as the noise level was nearly deafening.  Next time I am going to try the corned beef and cabbage - it looked delicious!

I really want to like this place.  I dig the cozy Irish Pub feel, but I am sorry, the service from the girls behind the bar consistently slow and unfriendly.  It's like we're invisible when we sit down at the bar.  I don't need that vibe at the end of a hard day.  The guy bartenders seem to be a lot more friendly and knowledgeable about the beers etc.  It's pretty clear some of the girls just don't give a crap.  Has potential, but needs some new blood.

This is a great little Irish bar. I am not a fan of Irish food so I have never eaten there but the drinks and decor are great! My husband and I actually went here on our first date and then went again after we got married and the owner made us a special drink and toasted us. What a great place!

I was looking for a lunch place near my office when I came across The Skeptical Chymist on Yelp so I thought I would give it a try. When looking at their menu I came across Beef Wellington which I love and is hard to find in the valley anymore.Ordered takeout with a side of scallops potatoes very tastie but the portion size was very small otherwise I would have given higher marks also the sauce was au jus a brown sauce or perigourdine sauce would have been a better choice.

Took twenty minutes to get a drink on a dead Thursday night at 6:50pm. Vodka with splash of soda was all soda and no vodka. Ordered the salmon sandwich with scalloped potatoes. Salmon was the saltiest fish I ever ate. Potatoes had zero seasoning. Will never come back.

Of course this is a huge Seahawks bar, but in the offseason it should be safe for cardinals fans to enter. The patio is a smoky crowded mess, so avoid that, but the bar was empty and had good service on a Thursday night. I just had two Carlsberg beers for 7 bucks total as that is an everyday special. Food looked ok, but Monday burger night seems to be the most popular night. Whoever was playing music was good as well. Not a bad hour long visit.

Went here for the first time after seeing and hearing about it for years. It was a weekday night, came for dinner. They had an acoustic guitar player/singer who was really good, added bonus. By the time we had finished dinner, place was almost vacant by 8 PM. Seems like a nice "after work, get a beer" type place. The fish and chips were pretty good, but I thought it was way overpriced at around 16 bucks. I don't go to bars because I don't drink and drive, plus, I'm just not that social. That being said, I don't think I'll be back for the food either. One and done, Was OK.

1st visit:

Friday lunch - Can't beat the "All You Can Eat" Fish & Chips Friday special. Fries aren't anything to get excited about, but the pieces of fish are massive and delicious.

Very nice selection of beers, on tap and in bottles.

Good service. Convenient location. Lots of parking.

Decor is fun to look at. All kinds of old medicine bottles, antique signs, other memorabilia.

Fun place. I'll be back.
I cannot believe they took the crab cakes off their menu.  I was tempted to leave, but the shepard's pie keeps me there.

If you're a Seahawks fan, this is the place to be in Arizona! My old roommates found it when they first moved here & I never understood the hype til they took me! We're from Seattle so it's nice to be in a place that reminds us of home with all the fellow 12s! On game days, this place is CRACKIN'! If you don't show up early, be prepared to stand to watch the game but it's worth it! The owner & staff is overly friendly, the food is delicious & the drinks are bomb. I like their 5$ mimosas on Sundays! If you order, make sure to order the fish tacos or chicken tenders. They're to die for! Their corned beef is good too if you're in the mood. This place is amazing!

Enjoyable afternoon atmosphere, and even tough it was about 110 outside, we were able to sit on the patio near the bar and smoke. If the group of people I met while there are any indication, the clientele is quite friendly and approachable. I'd like to go back in the evening and see what sort of selection they have of single ladies! 

By the way, the service was good. My friend ordered some food and what I ate of it was good, typical bar food. I'll definitely go back on a ladies night!

Service was horrible we walked in yes they were busy but the staff particularly the dark haired server with glasses probably mid-forties was very very rude.  We sat at a table that had some dirty dishes which our group stacked up to help out.  The server came over grabbed the dishes and my friend thanked her, the server snarled and never spoke.  We sat a few more minutes the server came back and wiped only a portion of the table still not saying a word to us. We then over heard two staff members talking saying "who's going to take them, someone has to"!  We sat a few more minutes then decided to leave.  One of our parties in the group wanted to tell the manager who was bartending how the service was.  The rest of us waited outside and another group came out gripping upset with service.  They had ordered drinks and sat for 30 mins and never got the drinks so left.   The manager ignored our group member not even saying I'll be right with you.   Would never recommend or go there again.  Too bad the live entertainment was good but playing wrong place.

I've only gone during the day for lunch, and the food has always been fantastic.  They have great lunch specials and every beer you possibly could think of.  I'm not a beer drinker, but everyone there seemed to be lovin' it.  Service has always been great and friendly.  I would go back anytime - at least during the day.

This is our home away from home!  The service is always very friendly, the food is great, and the prices are always reasonable.  They have a fantastic happy hour and a great selection of beer.  The corned beef and cabbage is so good!  Really all of their food is great.  Good bar to go watch sports or to hear some good live music later on the weekends.

I have only been here for two things. BAR TRIVIAAAA and Happy Hour! BOTH ARE GREAT let me tell you. The last time my team (a group of my friends) played bar trivia we got second place and I got to keep our prize, a Skeptical Chymist gift card. Which I definitely used. Let me tell you, Four Peaks is literally next door, BUT during happy hour this place is a great spot for beer and some cheap food. The flatbreads are all half off on happy hour and they are great. I got one with chicken and red peppers etc. We also tried the half off cod sliders. Those were pretty good, tasted crispy etc. The tartar sauce was okay, and the bun was a little sweet, but hey, I am not gonna complain. The girls also enjoy cocktails on happy hour, one personal fave I have now is a 'snakebite' its half hefe and half cider. This is also on their happy hour for a mere $3 per beer! HOLLER.

Anyway, good beer, good food, I also like the out door tables. Although the face the freeway, whatever. On a hot day, the shade and the misters are what is good. Plus I like the wind blowing in my face from the cars whizzing by. Just kidding. Its not like that. But definitely check this place out for a casual happy hour. There is smoking on the patio, I believe. Not my thing especially when I am sitting out there, but hey if it suits you, there ya go.

Love this place. 
Ok don't let the exterior fool you. Yes it is a strip center. Yes you are in North Scottsdale. But for a pint of Guinness happiness...seriously get out of your car.

So this place is cozy and relaxed. Great for lunch or to relax after hours.  If you get a burger, be hungry or share.  That is all I'm gonna say.  And the fries...awesome.  They are crispy shoe strings of goodness to please your taste buds. The ruben is pretty good and sloppy. Will say, what the fish sliders.  The tarter sauce is...different?

Get close to the bar and check out the rotating seasonal beers if you are deviating from Guinness. (but really who does that in an Irish Pub?)  There are plenty of great whiskeys to taste.

Basically, this is your great hang out pub to enjoy and not got to the run of the mill.  Great mix of beverages to please one and all.

Enjoy!
The Irish nachos are delicious! Perfect choice for a bar breakfast before a Seahawks game with 100's of Seahawks fans.

After many more trips, they've won we move. They take reservations which is great for post work cocktails.

And I've fallen in love with their pork sliders and garlic french fries. There is green sauce that comes with the fries which I wish I could bottle. Mmmmm! 

Wait staff hustles and always keeps your drinks full.

I have been to this Irish place a few times now and I go there for close convenience and to meet friends. The beer of course is pretty good, they are Irish after all, the food is ok too, just like typical bar food. Its good enough to fill your stomach while you're drinking, but don't expect a gourmet meal out of it. I only gave it three stars because of the service and the incredible freaking noise in there. Bars are loud and fun, I get it, but must you crank up the music to the point that conversations are impossible? Perhaps the service is as o bad because they cant understand you either. I'll come back here, but only for the good beer.

The service here is horrible at best.  The food was ok and what you would expect from a pub. Our waitress (Linda) ignored our table like we had a plague. Our party sat down and she asked if we wanted anything. It was 15 min before we saw her again and when we did, we had to get her attention as she walked by our table. We ordered our drinks and a different runner brought them out. When our water was empty we went to the bar and the bartender refilled them for us. For our second round of drinks, someone from our party went to the bar and ordered our drinks because our waitress (Linda) kept walking by our table and never even cared to ask us if we needed anything.  Again we had to get her attention to place a good order. Not once from the time we placed our food order to the time we asked for our check, did she come by our table and ask if we were ok or needed anything. We ordered water for the table before we left and 10 min later she still had not brought them out. We had to ask another waitress who then brought them out. The restaurant wasn't packed, but it was busy. There were several empty tables and empty chairs in the place so to blame it on the crowd is a copout or an excuse.

If you want to taste the best fish & chip in the world, this is the place. We just came back from Alaska & Seattle, places supposed to have best fish & chip in the world, not even close. 
Staff is always friendly. This is a grate place.

I've been here quite a few times for after work drinks with coworkers since it's just down the street from where I work. It's an ok place, but with 4 Peaks just on the other side of the parking lot we usually tend to pass on this place. 

We went yesterday and it was a disappointment. We got there before they started charging a cover (at 4 pm) otherwise it would have been $10 to get in. I'm guessing that this was to pay for the limited tables, chairs and one tent they rented. Also the band who was singing "Your Body is a Wonderland" and something else by Snow Patrol. Also they were charging $6 for drinks. It was just a little ridiculous. It was pretty much imposable to get drinks or food inside, which those of us who have tried their food before, weren't big fans of anyway. And to top it all off they closed Rubio's next door. 

A funny sight were these two ladies who brought a little girl who looked like she was 6 and 2 babies who didn't look old enough to walk. The moms' had a beer in one hand and were each pushing their stroller with the other. I know times are tough, but it you can afford buying a $6 beer, you can afford getting a babysitter.

Went here the day after St. Patty's. Place was empty but the table we sat at still hadn't been wiped down. Still hadn't been wiped down by the time we left. Food was OK. I had a nice Black and Tan to start the meal and ordered the fish and chips. Received a huge portion of nicely fried Cod and shoe string fries. I personally like wedges or crinkle cut  round chips but it's not a big deal. They do have huge burgers and my friend couldn't finish his Cheese Burger. Neither had room for dessert. Typical pub. Nothing to rave about. Maybe they were just recovering from the day befores party. I'll give them another try the next time I'm in Scottsdale to see if I have a better experience.

We come here occasionally and decided it was time again.  The beer list is still impressive, maybe more than before. My problem was that I couldn't remember everything so after my Guinness I had difficulty with my second choice.  I hadn't noticed the music before: maybe it was louder.  The food was good...better than before, I think. Service wasn't great, particularly as we needed to leave for another engagement and couldn't find our server.  This is an interesting place to go but I may not hurry back.

Best mac & cheese! The smoked gouda is reminiscent of the velveta your mom used to make mac & cheese with but this is way classier and the addition on bacon, chicken, mushrooms and roasted tomatoes takes this traditionally simple dish to an elevated foodie level. Great food and even better service. Also a shout out to amazing fish and chips....and it's a Seahawks bar! See you there for preseason! I hear the Irish nachos are a must for game day.

Have you ever noticed how stupid people look when they dance to Irish music? 

Do you ever imagine that starting the night with shots of Irish whiskey will end with you placing drunken bets at the Indian casino while your boyfriend pukes in the bathroom?  

Do you ever find yourself in a deserted parking lot in North Scottsdale asking strangers if there are any establishments nearby that actually have customers?  

Do you ever sit on the patio and have men blow cigar smoke in your hair, thus tainting you for the rest of the night?  

Do you ever have a guy try to hit on you when the music is too loud to actually talk?  So, you just end up yelling at each other and shaking your head as if you actually understood a word they said.  Then, you motion that you are going outside and he decides to dance rape the poor girl who stayed behind. 

Needless to say, I'm skeptical about going back.

Yes, it's an "Irish" bar but not a bad one. The beer selection is adequate, the ambiance is pubby and the food is passable. I had the "spicy" chicken curry and have to say that I have never had a more bland "curry" in my life. Here's a suggestion, put some curry powder in it!

Over all it's a nice enough place to hang out but I only go because it's close to my office, I certainly wouldn't make it a point to come here otherwise.

Great beers on tap. Anything from nitros to ipas. Good Irish pub fare. I had the morning midden and it hit the spot. This is the place to go watch the Hawks whenever they are playing.
Good Happy Hour specials every day of the week.  GO HAWKS.
The steak salad was pretty tasty. Small menu but a wonderful atmosphere. They even have live music on the weekends.

Very cheerful, upbeat atmosphere. Excellent service. There is a huge screen that usually shows sports for the fans. And, a happy hour that makes the food significantly cheaper. If you are wanting to listen to modern Irish jigs while eating delicious food (who doesn't?!), read on.

I've ordered a number of appetizers and dishes here. The cod and pork sliders are by far the best. There are also wings, fries and Irish-style pizzas, and tacos, among other dishes. If you are a first-timer, make sure you go during happy hour (4 pm to 7 pm) and order pork tacos and cod sliders; you won't regret it. God, I'm salivating just thinking about going back.

I like this place for a casual meal.  They have sweet potato fries which is always a plus for me.  The service can be a bit slow at times so may not be the best place to go when you're in a hurry.  Sporting events are always on the big screen TV and there is a live band that plays on the weekends.  I wasn't sure what to expect the first time I went, but I have returned a few times so they must be doing something right.  As a girl from New Mexico, I highly recommend the Green Chile cheeseburger.  I wish they had gluten free buns, but I just order the burger without a bun and it's super yummy.
For AZ standards this is an Irish Pub that made an effort in it's furnishing and I really enjoy the Apothecary look and feel.  Well done and great selection of beer on tap.

A few summers ago we had a chance to drive all over Ireland for two and a half weeks. The Skeptical Chymist has rekindled some of those memories and happily, have made a few new ones as well. 

For those who have been to Dublin, The Temple Bar near the River Lify is legendary. The main difference between the Skeptical Chymist and that pub is color. One is painted blue, and the other red.  Really. That's about it.  Oh except, this one has more Seahawk jerseys. LOL

If I understand the history correctly, the Skeptical Chymist acquired a lot of wood paneling and interior, from a Pub that was being torn down in Ireland. Well, it feels genuine, down to the Labrokes style Punter's Turf Window (photo).  Nice!

We came for Happy Hour (3-6, Mon-Sat), around five and we initially had the place to ourselves. That didn't last long because a NFL game started drawing in a crowd around five-thirty. 

Now, the Skeptical Chymist serves both Irish and Irish inspired food.  They have Lamb Shepherd's Pie, Corn Beef & Cabbage, Fish & Chips, Beef Wellington and my favorite, Irish Breakfast served all day.  

They also have Irish Nachos, Celtic Pot Stickers, Crispy Cod Sliders, Belfast Burger and Pub Fries.  Oh yes, you can find Guinness on tap, and Magners, aka Bulmers as well. The pub is well stocked, so you certainly won't be going home thirsty.

On our recent visit, we ordered the Irish Nachos for $12.79, which were excellent (photo). They were made with pulled pork and drizzled with a Sriracha sauce. Nice! Instead of corn chips, they've serve them with thick cut potato chips. So much for the famine.

We also had the Celtic Pot (photo) Stickers $10.79, made with corned beef and served with a spice teriyaki sauce. Great flavor. Great idea. 

The main take away about The Skeptical Chymist, Irish Pubs aside, is that it's a fun place to go. You will never have a bad time here, unless of course, the Seahawks are losing.  Go Seahawks!

Our tab came to $39.71 including taxes, but before gratuities. 

Enjoy!

A great place if you like the bar ambiance. The food is A-OK - to good. You kind of enter a different zone when you leave the strip mall atmosphere and enter the doors.  Great place for meeting a few friends.
Really great atmosphere for a strip mall Irish pub in North Scottsdale!  The happy hour is a great deal too - 4-7pm each day for $2 off draft beers...$3.25 for a pint of cider makes me very happy!
Great Irish Pub with delicious food and lots of great beer on tap. Great staff, excellent atmosphere, and the best Seahawks bar you'll ever go to!

Surprising Irish bar in Scottsdale AZ- largest Seahawks bar in AZ (go figure).  I had the Butcher's block: a pair of grilled lamb chops, braised pork belly, Irish Banger, black pudding (aka blutwurst, blood sausage, morcilla), skewered and grilled veggies, and mint dipping sauce.  Sounds heavier that what it really is- Irish light meal.  Everything, especially the lamb chops, was excellent.  After eating, you do not get that semi-comatose feeling from eating a heavy meal.  The bar itself is charming and has personality- even though it is a Seattle Seahawks bar.  The staff is very friendly and know their stuff.  Next time I am in the area I will try their version of Beef Wellington and the half dozen other dishes on their menu that sounded positively worth trying.  This is no ordinary sports bar.

Ah, one of my favorite pubs.  Good food, for Irish fare, and great beer.

Plus they have live music on the weekends, and a great vibe.  

If your in Scottsdale and need an Irish pub too hang out for a few, this is the place.

We concluded our St Patty's day event at the chemist. It is always a nice place to meet in N Scottsdale. For the event they build a huge tent in the parking lot to handle the overflow crowd. They were well staffed and very busy.  Nice work
We ended up getting sick after eating at this "restaurant". Only seems good as a bar. Service was on the slow side which you wouldn't expect for a Thursday.

I've been coming to Skeptical Chymist for several years and I am almost always extremely happy with the experience.  My husband and I typically like to go when they're having their "Pub Quiz" trivia night each week and we have also visited during special holiday events (St Paddy's Day, etc;)..  
Service is always friendly.. I have waited a little too long on busier nights, but I chalk that up to being in a crowded bar with people shouting out questions to the trivia caller.  It is a bit chaotic, but not uncomfortable and I've never had bad or rude service from the waitstaff or the bar.  
The food is tasty!  There is a plentiful selection of plenty of typical bar food and they pull it off easily.. They also have a nice offering of Irish-inspired choices and what we've sampled have all been very good.  The prices are quite reasonable and there is a different drink special every night - sometimes beers, sometimes cocktails - so our bill is never "too high".
The decor inside is really fantastic.  They've taken on the idea of a classic Dublin apothecary (with one side larger room that would be good for daytime lunch meetings styled as a library).. It is dark with plenty of tables and chairs and it is kept comfortably cool inside (but not freezing).  The patio is well lit and clean, so it's a nice place to wander during the nicer Arizona months.
Overall, I greatly enjoy my visits to Skeptical Chymist.  It's more interesting than your average bar/pub and the food is definitely fresher than anything you'll find at the average chain.

An excellent little Irish pub with good beer and authentic food. Ive had the fish and chips a few times and its always excellent. Had the shepherds pie today and was inspired to write a good review. Attentive service and "football" on the big screen..a solid experience.

This is a fun pub to meet up with friends for a pint - but the food isn't anything to rave about. They have great Happy Hour specials and a fun trivia night. Their big patio is a plus, too.

It's kind of in a wierd location though - hard to find - and parking isn't that great.

They also have a friendly staff - so I always like sitting at the bar.

Great place for lunch or happy hour.  Decorated like an old Irish pub, complete with old looking wood tables and bar.  Nice selection of off menu draught beers.  Happy hour specials are great prices for both food and drinks.  Nicely busy even with 3 other bars in the same center.  Outside tolerable at 105 with misters. Most tables filled by 5:30pm. Recommend for business lunch or meeting friends after work.

I haven't done bar trivia in a long time, so coming here with some smart Yelp folk seemed as good a time as ever to give it a go once again.

The food selection was typical bar food with an extra something here and there.  I had the bar wings and a few $4 Smithwick's.   Our waitress was very attentive and split our checks at the end of the night without a gripe.  The trivia itself was pretty challenging, I think I had some useful input for maybe a few answers.  And between rounds they gave out random prizes, I got a Rubik's Cube for chugging the rest of my beer!    

I might not be the smartest cookie at trivia, but when it comes to beer chugging I don't mess around!

I have heard about this place for years and in fact my son raves about the fish dinner he gets from here. I finally went when a friend dragged me for trivia night. So glad she did because this place is quite good. The atmosphere is eclectic and very comfortable. You feel like they want your business which as a customer I certainly appreciate. my drink was refilled over 4 times and I never asked. The food was delicious. We all got something different and each of us said it was great. We also tried a desert to share and it was enormous and definitely was good for 3 or 4 people. We weren't able to finish it. I highly recommend this charming place and I plan to return and try some of the dishes I read about in the reviews. I played it safe with a green  chili burger but it was spectacular. Very unique.  My friend had the appetizer tacos which she said were spicy and delicious. The other people both had specialty burgers. Loved this place-will return.

I've been coming here for quite some time since the days of when they first opened.  The bar has started to see better days with the chairs and interior seeming a little old and run down.  When they first opened they had some of the better burgers in the area but something has changed.  The food is still decent and not bad by a long shot but it's not what it once was.  

I ordered the Beef Wellington, while the dish was tasty and how many bars can you go to these days that even offer that as a dish but it wasn't put together the best and was falling apart after bite #2.  Good place to come see some live music and enjoy a Guinness but it's definitely a place that looks better with a big crowd and in the darkness

Love this place normally but obnoxious and loud "musician" on Wednesday nights will keep our group away every time. Calling out people eating dinner with friends and making insulting comments was very unnecessary. Very disappointed to hear he's there every Wednesday night. No more work groups there during the dinner hour that night going forward. Dinner crowd cleared out shortly after blaring sound started. You would think the staff would alert management that their tips are impacted by this. Last table of 8 I host there. Sorry friends!

Worst experience ever!  We came here for lunch on St Patrick's Day & had the "unluck" of the Irish by having a clueless server. It took 58 MINUTES for our food to arrive!  Given they were very busy, she should have known after 30 minutes that something was wrong!  We tried to be very patient and waited and waited and waited.  The table next to us were vacated and the next group came in and got their food while we were still being patient and was waiting for our food.  Then the table to the other side of us was once again vacated and two men sat down.  At this time, I decided to check my iPhone as I had checked into Yelp right after we placed our order and noticed that it had been more than 40 minutes since!

Meanwhile, I was starting to really get hungry and started to get clammy, shaky and started sweating.  I grabbed our server and told her that I wasn't feeling too good because I was too hungry, my sugar level was really low and asked for orange juice or a piece of bread.  She came back with a side order of fries to "tide" us over as the kitchen was still working on our order.  One of us told her to check and see that maybe our order was misplaced in the pipeline... She said that she was really trying and that the kitchen was just too busy.  This was hard to fathom as the restaurant had a set menu of about 5 items!

Suddenly the table with the two men got served!  They ordered fish and chips and started eating and still no food for our table!  We had ordered two orders of fish and chips and 3 salads.  How long does it take to prepare this?????????

We once again asked the waitress where our food was and asked her how the the two men got served before us when they came way after we did... Same answer.

Anyways, the food finally came and we were starving, we ate, she brought us the bill, no apologies, no remorse, etc... We paid the bill in full, even gave her a 20% tip.

I would be very SKEPTICAL about the SKEPTICAL CHYMIST!!!!

Really liked this place.  It's a big place, with plenty of outdoor seating as well.  I love the Irish pub feel, although the outdoor pub facade in a strip mall was kind of weird.  Old pub feel inside, with some decent happy hour and reverse happy hour specials, good food, and good beer on tap.  Plus I live right around the corner.  Will definitely be back!

Good food and good service. Shepard's Pie is legit, made with lamb, and came with some very thick bread. Reuben was made with brisket instead of the usual corned beef, which was an interesting twist. All served by a helpful and personable waitress.

This is mine and my husband's go to restaurant.  We usually go out to dinner on Friday nights and we normally go to Skeptical Chymist!  The food here is fantastic, and this is saying a lot since we never thought we'd find a decent, reasonably priced place to eat after we moved here from the Midwest.  We've tried more than half of the menu items and never had a bad meal.  We go after he gets out of work so their happy hour specials are still available (50% off appetizers.)  Even if we're a couple of minutes late they still ALWAYS give us the happy hour discount, just ask!  We usually split a few appetizers and share a bread pudding dessert which is more than enough for dinner.

Although I have many favorites, if I was forced to only recommend one item off the menu it would be the braised rib sliders!
